episode_summary: This Christmas special episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' features festive facts about the oldest turkey in the UK, a gift exchange tradition between Cary Grant and Clark Gable, the phenomenon of Christmas trees turning to glass in extreme cold, and Pope Francis releasing a prog rock album.

facts.fact: The oldest turkey in the UK is called Dinner.
Cary Grant and Clark Gable used to meet up once a year around Christmas to exchange unwanted monogrammed gifts they'd received.
When it gets really cold, Christmas trees can turn to glass.
One of the contenders for this year's Christmas charts is a prog rock album by Pope Francis.
